The Texas Family Code allows a judge to refer certain matters, including a suit affecting the parent-child relationship, to an associate judge for a ruling. A party may request a de novo hearing before the referring court by filing a written request within three days of receiving notice of the associate judge's order.

The Texas Family Code provides for the appointment of associate judges to assist with completing Title IV-D child support cases referred to an associate judge by an appropriate court. An associate judge may hold a trial on the merits and recommend an order to the referring district court.
